intro: Coilonox secundum, commonly known as the spiral fern, is a unique plant characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. The plant features long, narrow fronds that spiral around a central stem, creating an intricate and aesthetically pleasing pattern. Its rhizomes are fibrous and help anchor it to moist, shaded environments. Coilonox secundum is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking appearance and adaptability to humid conditions.
